title: Library Teen Volunteer
shortDescription: Support your local library by helping with shelving, organizing materials, and assisting at children’s programs.
fullDescription: Teens ages 13–17 can volunteer at Oakland Public Library branches. Duties include shelving books, preparing crafts for storytime, helping with events, and assisting staff.

title: Online Coding Mentor
shortDescription: Help middle and high school students learn coding basics through guided projects.
fullDescription: Code Nation connects high school volunteers with younger students to mentor them in introductory programming. Volunteers support students with Python and web development projects via Zoom.

title: Environmental Cleanup Volunteer
shortDescription: Join monthly cleanup events to keep Oakland’s parks, creeks, and trails beautiful.
fullDescription: Volunteers help remove litter, plant greenery, and maintain trails in Oakland’s public spaces. Gloves, tools, and training are provided.

title: Remote Adoption Counselor
shortDescription: Help match rescued cats and dogs with loving homes by assisting adopters online.
fullDescription: Volunteers communicate with potential adopters, answer questions, and help process applications. This remote role is ideal for animal lovers.

title: Teen Blog Contributor
shortDescription: Write articles for the library’s teen newsletter about books, local events, and history.
fullDescription: Teens research and write short blog posts for SFPL’s youth newsletter. Topics range from book reviews to local history and cultural events.

title: Youth Program Assistant
shortDescription: Support after-school and weekend youth programs at the YMCA.
fullDescription: Teen volunteers assist with recreational activities, arts and crafts, and mentoring younger children.

title: Build Site Volunteer
shortDescription: Help construct affordable housing for families in need.
fullDescription: Teens ages 16+ can join supervised build days, assisting with painting, landscaping, and light construction.

title: Meal Delivery Assistant
shortDescription: Deliver meals to seniors and brighten their day.
fullDescription: Teens can accompany adult volunteers to deliver meals and provide companionship to seniors.

title: Youth Club Volunteer
shortDescription: Join Red Cross youth clubs to organize blood drives and community events.
fullDescription: High school students can join Red Cross youth clubs to plan service projects, promote safety, and support disaster relief.

title: Online Campaign Volunteer
shortDescription: Join national campaigns on social issues from home.
fullDescription: DoSomething.org offers online campaigns for teens to take action on issues like climate change, mental health, and equality.

title: Kitchen Helper
shortDescription: Assist in preparing nutritious meals for people living with serious illnesses.
fullDescription: Teens can help chop vegetables, package meals, and support kitchen staff at Project Open Hand, which provides meals to people with HIV/AIDS, cancer, and other critical illnesses.

title: Tree Planting Volunteer
shortDescription: Help plant and care for trees in San Francisco neighborhoods.
fullDescription: Join monthly tree planting events to improve air quality and beautify the city. Volunteers learn about urban forestry and environmental stewardship.

title: Warehouse Volunteer
shortDescription: Sort and pack food donations for families in need.
fullDescription: Teens can volunteer in the food bank warehouse to organize donations, pack boxes, and support distribution efforts.

title: Writing Tutor
shortDescription: Support younger students with creative writing and homework help.
fullDescription: 826 Valencia offers after-school tutoring and writing workshops. Teen volunteers help elementary and middle school students with assignments and creative projects.

title: Trail Maintenance Volunteer
shortDescription: Help maintain trails and habitats in Golden Gate National Recreation Area.
fullDescription: Teens join monthly workdays to clear brush, repair trails, and restore native habitats in Bay Area parks.

title: Literacy Tutor
shortDescription: Help elementary school students improve their reading skills.
fullDescription: Reading Partners trains volunteers to work one-on-one with students who need extra support in literacy.

title: Animal Care Assistant
shortDescription: Support staff in caring for shelter animals.
fullDescription: Teen volunteers help with feeding, cleaning, and socializing cats and dogs awaiting adoption.

title: Museum Youth Volunteer
shortDescription: Assist with exhibits and children’s programs at the museum.
fullDescription: Teens help facilitate hands-on exhibits, guide families, and support special events at the museum.

title: Environmental Intern
shortDescription: Join a youth-led team working on sustainability projects.
fullDescription: Earth Team offers internships for high school students to work on recycling, climate education, and environmental justice projects.

title: Program Helper
shortDescription: Assist troop leaders with activities and events.
fullDescription: Teen volunteers help lead activities, mentor younger scouts, and support community service projects.
